    • Method Detail

      • addRetailer

        public void addRetailer(Map<String,Object> params,
               ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Create a retailer record. A billable entity must be created first before a retailer record can be made.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.streetAddress
          The street address
        • SirqulKeys.streetAddress2
          Additional address information (such as a suite number, floor number, building name, or PO Box)
        • SirqulKeys.city
          The city
        • SirqulKeys.state
          The state
        • SirqulKeys.postalCode
          The postal code
        • SirqulKeys.businessPhone
          The business phone
        • SirqulKeys.businessPhoneExt
          The business phone extension
        • SirqulKeys.website
          The website of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.facebookUrl
          The facebook URL of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.twitterUrl
          The twitter URL of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.logoFilePath
          File path to the retailer logo sent as a multipart binary file (you can optionally use logoAssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.logoAssetId
          The retailer logo asset id
        • SirqulKeys.picture1FilePath
          File path to optional store-front pictures or product pictures or etc. A multipart binary file (you can optionally use picture1AssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.picture1AssetId
          An asset id
        • SirqulKeys.picture2FilePath
          File path to optional store-front pictures or product pictures or etc. A multipart binary file (you can optionally use picture2AssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.picture2AssetId
          An asset id
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          Comma separated list of category IDs used to filter retailers by categories
        • SirqulKeys.filterIds
          Comma separated list of filter IDs used to filter retailers
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The current location of the user
        • SirqulKeys.createDefaultLocation
          Determines whether to create a default location using the retailer information
        • SirqulKeys.responseFormat
          The format of the returned response {JSON // default , HTML // for Dojo support when uploading assets}

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        StringResponse if responseFormat equals Enums.ResponseFormat.XML or Enums.ResponseFormat.HTML and a WrappedResponse<RetailerFullResponse> if responseFormat equals any other Enums.ResponseFormat. On error, returns SirqulResponse with message.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        RetailerApiBase.addRetailer

      • addRetailerLocation

        public void addRetailerLocation(Map<String,Object> params,
                       ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Creates a location record for a retailer. Only the owner and the employees of the retailer have access to do this.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/location/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.retailerId
          The ID of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.streetAddress
          The street address of the retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.streetAddress2
          Additional address information (such as a suite number, floor number, building name, or PO Box)
        • SirqulKeys.city
          The city
        • SirqulKeys.state
          The state
        • SirqulKeys.postalCode
          The postal code
        • SirqulKeys.businessPhone
          The business phone
        • SirqulKeys.businessPhoneExt
          The business phone extension
        • SirqulKeys.website
          The website of the retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.internalId
          An internal identifier used by the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.detailsHeader
          A brief description about the retailer location (255 character limit)
        • SirqulKeys.detailsBody
          A detailed description about the retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.hours
          The hours of operation
        • SirqulKeys.logoFilePath
          The file path to the retailer location logo sent as a multipart binary file (you can optionally use logoAssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.logoAssetId
          The retailer location logo asset id
        • SirqulKeys.picture1FilePath
          The file path to an optional store-front pictures or product pictures or etc. A multipart binary file (you can optionally use picture1AssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.picture1AssetId
          An asset id
        • SirqulKeys.picture2FilePath
          The file path to an optional store-front pictures or product pictures or etc. A multipart binary file (you can optionally use picture2AssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.picture2AssetId
          An asset id
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          Comma separated list of category IDs used to filter retailer locations by categories
        • SirqulKeys.filterIds
          Comma separated list of filter IDs used to filter retailer locations
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The current location of the user
        • SirqulKeys.building
          the building
        • SirqulKeys.responseFormat
          The format of the returned response {JSON // default , HTML // for Dojo support when uploading assets}

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        StringResponse if responseFormat equals Enums.ResponseFormat.XML or Enums.ResponseFormat .HTML and a WrappedResponse< RetailerLocationResponse> if responseFormat equals any other Enums.ResponseFormat. On error, returns SirqulResponse with message.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        RetailerApiBase.addRetailerLocation

        public void getRetailer(Map<String,Object> params,
               ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<RetailerFullResponse>> callback)
        Gets a retailer. Only the owner and the employees of a retailer have access to view its information.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/get

        Available parameters for this api

          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.retailerId
          the ID of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.includeCounts
          the include counts

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        A WrappedResponse<RetailerFullResponse> on a valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:

      • removeRetailer

        public void removeRetailer(Map<String,Object> params,
                  ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Set the deleted timestamp to current time. This effectively deletes the retailer since all queries should ignore any records with a deleted time stamp.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/delete

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account used to perform the delete, must have rights to edit the retailer.
        • SirqulKeys.retailerId
          The ID of the retailer to be deleted

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods.       • searchRetailerLocations

        public void searchRetailerLocations(Map<String,Object> params,
                           ISirqulCallback<ListResponse<RetailerLocationResponse>> callback)
        Retailer location (faster) indexed search. This searches on any retailer location. Use searchRetailerLocations for searching on retailers that an account has access to (for the Sirqul retailer site).

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/location/isearch

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The start index for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The limit for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.hasOffers
          boolean to indicate whether to include retailer locations that have no offers
        • SirqulKeys.categories
          List of category ids
        • SirqulKeys.filters
          List of filter ids
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The field to sort the result set on
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          the keyword
        • SirqulKeys.booleanQuery
          the boolean query

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        ListResponse<RetailerLocationResponse> on valid response, SirqulResponse on invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        RetailerApiBase.searchRetailerLocations

      • searchRetailerLocationsByRange

        public void searchRetailerLocationsByRange(Map<String,Object> params,
                                  ISirqulCallback<ListResponse<RetailerLocationResponse>> callback)
        Search retailer locations by range.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/location/idistancesearch

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location to center the search on
        • SirqulKeys.searchRange
          the search range in kilometers
        • SirqulKeys.start
          the start index for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          the limit for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.hasOffers
          boolean to indicate whether to include retailer locations that have no offers
        • SirqulKeys.categories
          list of category ids
        • SirqulKeys.filters
          list of filter ids
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The field to sort the result set on
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          Search by keyword
        • SirqulKeys.booleanQuery
          the boolean query. See http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cloudsearch/latest/developerguide/ searching.html and See http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cloudsearch/latest/developerguide/ booleansearch.html for more details on how to use boolean search.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a ListResponse of RetailerLocationResponse on success, or SirqulResponse on failure with message.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:

      • updateAds

        public void updateAds(Map<String,Object> params,
             ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Updates retailers that are marked to be saved to index reporting data.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/location/searchindex/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key - only Sirqul app is allowed
        • SirqulKeys.searchTag
          run for rows that have this "searchTags" value - ignores the "insearchindex" value
        • SirqulKeys.batchCount
          This number of records to process
        • SirqulKeys.maxUpdateSearchIndexRecords
          This maximum records to upload to the AWS search index at once. AWS Search has a 5MB limit for submissions so setting this too high will cause this to error out. Keep in mind that this is either the total number of RetailerLocations OR Offers since the RetailerLocation and Offer indices are updated at the same time. So the first one to reach 1000 records will trigger the save for both.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        RetailerApiBase.updateAds

      • updateRetailer

        public void updateRetailer(Map<String,Object> params,
                  ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Update a retailer record. Only the owner and the employees of the retailer have access to update its information.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.retailerId
          The ID of the retailer to update
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.streetAddress
          The street address
        • SirqulKeys.streetAddress2
          Additional address information (such as a suite number, floor number, building name, or PO Box)
        • SirqulKeys.city
          The city
        • SirqulKeys.state
          The state
        • SirqulKeys.postalCode
          The postal code
        • SirqulKeys.businessPhone
          The business phone
        • SirqulKeys.businessPhoneExt
          The business phone extension
        • SirqulKeys.website
          The website of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.facebookUrl
          The facebook URL of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.twitterUrl
          The twitter URL of the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.logoFilePath
          File path to the retailer logo sent as a multipart binary file (you can optionally use logoAssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.logoAssetId
          The retailer logo asset id
        • SirqulKeys.picture1FilePath
          File path to optional store-front pictures or product pictures or etc. A multipart binary file (you can optionally use picture1AssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.picture1AssetId
          An asset id
        • SirqulKeys.picture2FilePath
          File path to optional store-front pictures or product pictures or etc. A multipart binary file (you can optionally use picture2AssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.picture2AssetId
          An asset id
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          Comma separated list of category IDs used to filter retailers by categories
        • SirqulKeys.filterIds
          Comma separated list of filter IDs used to filter retailers
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The current location of the user.
        • SirqulKeys.responseFormat
          the response format

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        StringResponse if responseFormat equals Enums.ResponseFormat.XML or Enums.ResponseFormat.HTML and a WrappedResponse<RetailerFullResponse> if responseFormat equals any other Enums.ResponseFormat. On error, returns SirqulResponse with message.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        RetailerApiBase.updateRetailer

      • updateRetailerLocation

        public void updateRetailerLocation(Map<String,Object> params,
                          ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Updates a location record for a retailer. Only the owner and the employees of the retailer have access to do this.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/location/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.retailerLocationId
          The ID of the retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.streetAddress
          The street address of the retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.streetAddress2
          Additional address information (such as a suite number, floor number, building name, or PO Box)
        • SirqulKeys.city
          The city
        • SirqulKeys.state
          The state
        • SirqulKeys.postalCode
          The postal code
        • SirqulKeys.businessPhone
          The business phone
        • SirqulKeys.businessPhoneExt
          The business phone extension
        • SirqulKeys.website
          The website of the retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.internalId
          An internal identifier used by the retailer
        • SirqulKeys.detailsHeader
          A brief description about the retailer location (255 character limit)
        • SirqulKeys.detailsBody
          A detailed description about the retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.hours
          The hours of operation
        • SirqulKeys.logoFilePath
          The file path to the retailer location logo sent as a multipart binary file (you can optionally use logoAssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.logoAssetId
          The retailer location logo asset id
        • SirqulKeys.picture1FilePath
          The file path to an optional store-front pictures or product pictures or etc. A multipart binary file (you can optionally use picture1AssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.picture1AssetId
          An asset id
        • SirqulKeys.picture2FilePath
          The file path to an optional store-front pictures or product pictures or etc. A multipart binary file (you can optionally use picture2AssetId if the asset has already been uploaded before)
        • SirqulKeys.picture2AssetId
          An asset id
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          Comma separated list of category IDs used to filter retailer locations by categories
        • SirqulKeys.filterIds
          Comma separated list of filter IDs used to filter retailer locations
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The current location of the user
        • SirqulKeys.building
          the building
        • SirqulKeys.responseFormat
          The format of the returned response {JSON // default , HTML // for Dojo support when uploading assets}

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        StringResponse if responseFormat equals Enums.ResponseFormat.XML or Enums.ResponseFormat.HTML and a WrappedResponse<RetailerLocationResponse> if responseFormat equals any other Enums.ResponseFormat. On error, returns SirqulResponse with message.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        RetailerApiBase.updateRetailerLocation
